result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly A. Riel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Discussion held; Court reviews defendant's right to prelim and finds def f&v waives that right;   Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with Michelle Garb.   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.   Restrictions on travel: Shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

Defendant Kelly A. Riel in court, in custody via video from Jail with attorney Greg E. Vollan (eligible).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $2500 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with Michelle Garb. Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.   Restrictions on travel: Shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
